intro: Gonocaryum crassifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf gonocaryum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
